meanings.definition: In a firm or secure manner
meanings.sent1: She held onto the railing tightly to avoid falling.
meanings.sent2: The lid was screwed tightly onto the jar.
meanings.sent3: The cat wrapped itself tightly in a blanket, pretending to be a burrito.
meanings.sent4: His schedule was tightly packed with back-to-back meetings.
meanings.sent5: The rope was tied tightly around the tree trunk, ensuring it wouldn't move.

meanings.definition: In a close or compact manner
meanings.sent1: The books were stacked tightly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The friends huddled tightly together to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: The suitcase was packed so tightly that it wouldn't close.
meanings.sent4: The flowers were tightly bunched in the vase, creating a beautiful arrangement.
meanings.sent5: The team worked tightly as a unit, achieving their goal together.

meanings.definition: In a strict or constricting manner
meanings.sent1: The rules were enforced tightly to maintain order.
meanings.sent2: The dress fit tightly around her waist.
meanings.sent3: The budget was managed tightly to avoid overspending.
meanings.sent4: The grip of fear held tightly onto his heart.
meanings.sent5: The vines twisted tightly around the old fence, creating a natural barrier.
